intro: Oxytheca parishii, commonly known as the Australian burr daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny bracts that enclose its small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that reduce water loss, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in spring. Oxytheca parishii is often found in sandy soils and is a common sight in coastal and inland areas of southern Australia.
